instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
#[allow(clippy::manual_map)] fn inc(opt: Option<i32>) -> Option<i32> { match opt { Some(x) => Some(x + 1), None => None } }
```

## Compiler Error:
clippy::manual_map: use .map() instead of suppressing the lint

## Fixed Code:
output: fn inc(opt: Option<i32>) -> Option<i32> { opt.map(|x| x + 1) }

instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
#[allow(clippy::manual_map)] fn to_upper(opt: Option<String>) -> Option<String> { match opt { Some(s) => Some(s.to_uppercase()), None => None } }
```

## Compiler Error:
clippy::manual_map: use .map() instead of suppressing the lint

## Fixed Code:
output: fn to_upper(opt: Option<String>) -> Option<String> { opt.map(|s| s.to_uppercase()) }
